page.title: 01REVIEW OF THE BLOCK 05040348
page.content: The block is situated in an area of {intensive agriculture,}on the gently sloping,permeable jurassic limestone dip-slope of{Lincoln Edge.}Population is light,with Leasingham village on the south side and limited dwellings in the North-East corner,plus several {farms}in the area,and isolated private housing.{House prices are low}compared to the national average. The main{A15 road to Lincoln}runs from the South to the North-East of the block. There are{limited shopping}amenities in Leasingham,the nearest main shopping centre being three miles away in the town of{Sleaford. The whole of the farming land to the South of Leasingham is part of the {Roxholme Estate,}covering the parishes of Roxholm,Ruskington and Leasingham, then on into Cranwell and Rauceby.
